We couldn't get the food in our mouths fast enough - this place has a limited menu but is absolutely savage! We had chips with guacamole, pork mole verde, chicken taquitos (dorado tacos) and black beans. 

Let's start with the chips - the warm, home made chips and fresh guacamole with chunks of Mexican cheese. So good! The black beans were perfectly cooked and creamy the pork was tender and the mole was not too rich not too spicy and not to dark - again so good! 

The service and location were great - we can see ourselves becoming regulars at El Buen Comer!
author: Melissa G.

description:
The food was tasty and I appreciated the quality of the ingredients that they use as well as the home made tortillas. However, the food was particularly pricey but what I found unacceptable is that we paid more than $10 of extras that were not communicated by the staff beforehand: We asked for more salsa and the bill included a $2 surcharge for a small plastic cup of salsa to which you add tax and tip. A request for more chips ended up with another $2+tax+tip surcharge for a cup of tortilla chips. 3 additional tortillas did cost an extra of $2.75+tax+tip. Again, you can definitely notice that these are quality ingredients but I find that this is not an acceptable practice to not communicate, at a minimum, that these come at an extra cost. 

Some people like to fly low cost airlines where everything is extra but at least you know before you take your seat. Personally, when it comes to restaurants and food, I want to feel that I am welcome and that food is an expression of the cook's generosity not feel that I am a walking wallet. Regardless, I like to sponsor businesses that embody impeccable ethics. Until El Buen Comer changes its practices, I will not return.
author: Laurent S.

description: Hands down the best chilaquiles I've had in forever, especially with their homemade hot sauce. Great service, decent prices and delicious food.
author: Carla C.

description:
Beautiful new place, spacious light and airy. The food is excellent as is the service. I had the chicken tacos, more like what I think of as flautas. They come with avocado slices and salad on top also rice and beans. The portions are a reasonable size. The service was friendly and fast.

We shared flan after and it was wonderfully creamy and had coconut. Definitely get the flan.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Great ambience, clean, modern looking, friendly staff, delicious food, clean bathroom.  I I liked the enchilladas, my son likes the carnitas, hubby liked the cactus salad, youngest likes Chinese food, LOL.
author: A M.

description:
Nothing feels better than supporting local talent, especially when its right in your neighborhood.  But, having said that, I feel super confident that you don't have to be from my neighboorhood, city or even state to enjoy what Doña Isabel is cooking in her kitchen at El Buen Comer.  
In fact, I waited until I had some out of town guests in order to sample the menu, though small, it's concise, and there are some staples, as well as specials written in, which I assume change weekly.  
We started with guacamole, and this is the holy-moley-guacamole, without any sour cream, tomatoes, or fillers, just the avo, lime, cilantro, and garnished with healthy cubes of lovely cotija cheese.  The guacamole comes with their signature chips, I can only surmise are made from their own hand made tortillas, some of which soufflé up and make themselves into little guac scoops!  Its a must-order.
We tried three different kinds of sope, though you can choose from taco, sope, or tostada, each on the home made masa base you decide on.  We picked chicken tinga, cactus(nopales), and chicharrón.  All were really amazing.  That chicharrón is not the crispy kind, its more like a lovely tripe, not for the weak of heart, but for the experience, its right in the zone.  This all comes out on beautiful clay plates and a small bowl of their potent green sauce, which you only need to augment the food with a drop of.  Any more, and you throw off the existing balance.
Isabel's food is homey but everything on each plate is seasoned with care.  Rice and sumptuous black beans accompanied chicken chilaquiles, and it was a symphony of flavor, with the lead violin being played by the spicy salsa roja.  Nothing lacked, and there is no greasy soggy undesirable, oh no, quite the opposite, señorita, its a plate-licker.  You will be tempted to get after every last freaking molecule.
The Milanesa de Res, I know, some people are going to expect a different Milanesa, but this is razor-thin slices of good beef, dredged in breadcrumb lightly and deep-fried.  Comes with Salad and the Notorious R&B(rice and beans).  I had the wherewithall to order an over easy #eggporn with that to seal the deal as it was still within the weekend brunch hours, so I felt the calling and the calling was answered.  I will be haunted by this dish in my sleep.  Don't expect a wienerschnitzel-type Milanesa and you won't be disappointed.  If you are looking for a more Teutonic pounded meat, go to Schmidt's or Los Panchos, son.
Flan, oh the flan, it was coconut-crusted and freaking FLANTASTIC, and I will get it again.
So, if you're looking for the real deal authentic, not trying to be fancy but definitely Distrito Federal, Mexico City, México, Uber, Lyft, drive, run, bike, but don't walk to this lovely rustic family operation and support your local delicious-maker, ¡Oralé!  Buen Provecho.
author: Kevin M.

description: This place is amazing!  We had breakfast and the huevos divorciados and chilaquiles were perfection!  I ordered a couple sopes just because...and they were the real deal.  If you love good authentic Mexican food that tastes like abuelita cooked it, come here.
author: A B.

description: I came to dinner on 12/21/16 for the second time to El Buen Comer for a pre-holiday dinner with my husband. The food was good and our server was very polite. When we got our check I mentioned to the server that the price of the tortillas was really high (10dls for 10 tortillas, 1dl per tortilla). I asked to speak to the manager, I wanted to tell him that the price of the tortillas was too high, my dinner plate was 15dls and it was meat, rice and beans. The manager said that nobody had complaint before, and that the tortillas were organic. I said that I understood they were organic but in my opinion still very expensive, he said "ok but nobody has complaint". I told him I was just giving him my opinion and that I was going to writte a review on yelp and that is how places start to get a bad reputation. He told me if I needed his name so I could include it in the review to let him know and walked away. Another man asked him if everything was alright and he said "she thinks everything is expensive"...the man's response was that he buy's expensive ingredients so he can sell expensive food!. The point of this review is not even about the tortillas anymore, but I am completely amazed at the lack of professionalism and customer service this restaurant has. Both of these man were in charge, and they were both very rude and unapologetic. The menu of this restaurant has a story of the way it began, and how they got support from "La Cocina",  (a program I have supported and given many donations to) and it says that when one comes to El Buen Comer they hope one feels like at their house.... I guess they failed this time to make us feel at home huh? Needless to say I will never come back to this restaurant, I don't mind paying reasonable prices for good quality food but if you want to charge like you are a five star restaurant maybe you should treat your customers like a five star restaurant as well...it's a shame because the food is good, but in a competitive market like San Francisco you need much more than good food to last!
author: Monica M.

description: This place is the best. By far my favorite up and coming spot in the neighborhood. I'm constantly taking friends here. Try the mole!
author: Ariel S.

description: We're so lucky living in San Francisco....El Buen Comer is a great Mexico City Style restaurant....my first visit for lunch was just wonderful....I had steak slices breaded and lightly fried with black beans and yellow rice.... couldn't stop saying "damn that's good".  Please try this place out...I will be going there for dinner very very soon.... Five stars for sure. Great atmosphere. Parking can be an issue. Take Lyft !
author: David R.

description: Mole = amazing.  I never even liked mole until trying their chicken mole, and now I'm spoiled forever. :)   Make sure to get the large order of homemade tortillas!
author: smegalandtootsie s.

description: Would not recommend for catering. I went to the restaurant and inquired about catering and was told that I should call Ana but that she may not call me back because she's very busy. Huh? Seriously? Then I was told that I could leave my name and number for the manager which I did. No call back from him either. Finally, I called again and was told that the manager was unavailable. Disappointing and frustrating. I will not be returning.
author: Micah S.

description: Great guacamole and maybe the best enchiladas mole I've ever had. I'm looking forward to my next visit!
author: Brendan M.

description: Ordered the chilaquiles! They were ok, I had the green and my partner had the red. The red were def better. The café de olla was superb.
author: Janetta R.

description: Wonderful family owned and operated restaurant.  The chicken tinga sopes are very well flavored and soooo delicious.  The shrimp guisado is also excellent.  Service is always very friendly.  Perfect spot for when you want Mexican food, but already had a burrito for lunch. Lucky to have this in our neighborhood!
author: Sarah B.

description: Ordered this food for a party and it was great! The tamales were delicious and the chips were addictive! Yummmmm
author: Aimee E.

description: Delicious, authentic Mexican city style food. Come now before the hordes realize that it's here! Excellent food, friendly staff, highly recommend. They are still figuring some stuff out (sangria is only available two days a week but that's not noted on the menu, on Sundays they serve brunch all day and close at 7pm, service is bumpy etc) but the insane tortillas and mole verde make up for it! So happy to have this gem in the neighborhood.
author: Miranda J.

description: Best homemade Mexican food in San Francisco. Don't expect taqueria or your standard Mexican restaurant here. This is home cooking at its finest. Best tamales I have had (don't tell my MIL!). The food is region-specific to Mexico City.
author: Christina G.

description: 3 stars for a few reasons. 1) The portions are too small for the price.  The quality of the food does not make up for the price.2.) They have a small selection on their menu3) The shrimp is not fresh it's frozen small shrimp, for the price you would expect Tiger shrimp
author: Eduardo M.

description: Absolutely love this place ! It makes me feel like I'm back in Mexico ! Wish they had more of a variety , but overall the place is great !
author: Kristina A.

description: If you are looking for a traditional mexican meal, like those you only find in your abuelita´s houses, this is the place to go!
author: Azul O.

description: Warm, helpful & friendly service is just the start. Food is authentic and high quality. Margarita was balanced & not too sweet. Guisados were juicy & had robust flavor. Sopes were also incredible. Love everything about this place! Just had dinner & literally decided were coming back for brunch tomorrow:)
author: SF G.

description: Great homeade food.  Portions are on the smaller side.  Tortillas are literally 4" wide.  But its all delicious.  Coffee was not that great.
author: Gneaux C.

description: Decent restaurant on Mission near Bernal heights. Had a few vegetarian options. The stuffed chile was good but there was a calabacitas dish that was not worth the price ($18). The desserts were good. Too expensive for the quality and the portions are small.
author: Paul P.

description: Great service but... asking for salsa $2.5? Fake mini tortillas a mano? Tacos dorados with oregano? Nope. (Yes, I am super Mexican too)
author: Zahira G.

description:
Authentic! Authentic! Authentic! 
I am a Chicana raised in a family that lives to eat therefore I know my Mexican food.
This is not your regular Mission District Mexican joint (not that I don't love a late night burrito here and there). This is an authentic, family owned, home style Mexican food establishment. The flavors remind me of my last trip to Mexico City....spot on. We started with chips and guacamole. The chips are SO good and were freshly fried. The guacamole had great flavor, also tasted fresh. We all ordered sopes. We tried Papas con Chorizo, Chicharrón en Salsa Verde, and Frijol con Queso. The sopes are handmade and the masa tastes fresh and delicious. I wasn't too crazy about the chicharrón en salsa only because it had too much sauce for my liking, I still devoured it however. Maybe next time I'll request less sauce. Yes, there will be a next time. We also ordered Calabazitas. I had them with a side of black beans and fresh, hand made tortillas. I'm telling you, these tortillas are small but deadly; I could easily eat a basket to myself! 
The decor is super cute, artifacts imported from Mexico. The ambiance is calm, staff is super friendly. The place feels like you've walked into someone's home for dinner. Everything is served in Mexican clay dishes (which I love). There are so many more items on the menu that I can't wait to try. No alcohol is served but they do have beer & wine.
The owner, Isabel came out to greet us at the end of our meal. She is a sweet lady and I wish her all the success!!!! I will be back!
author: Claudia M.

description: I'm super excited about this addition to the neighborhood.  We had a fantastic weekend lunch at El Buen Comer and are excited to go back for more.  We loved the chip and guacamole, the guava agua fresca was refreshing and not too sweet and all the main dishes were great. My husband loved his mole tacos and I loved the Tacos Dorados.  The staff was very friendly and I loved the bright decor.  We will definitely return.
author: Jean K.

description: Great brunch. Guacamole was very good as were the tacos and sangria. Staff was friendly and we didn't have trouble getting at table for 3 at 1pm on Sunday.
author: Janell H.

description: Husband and I came in after a long morning in SF and this place exceeded all our expectations! Food is savory , small portions yes but enough to satisfy. It was rush hour and waiter left out our drinks,  by the way best agua de guyaba (guava), we totally understood so we nicely asked for them a second time. This time, we got them immediately and they were kindly taken off our check. Thank you!  We will definitely be back next time we are around!
author: Roxana C.

description: Everything is so good! My favorite is the pork tamales with their orange hot sauce! The sauce has such good flavor and just the right amount of heat that's not overwhelming. Only thing that makes Saturday's worth working!
author: Yvette M.

description: Amazing traditional Mexican food! Went there for brunch and really LOVED what I ordered: the enchiladas with the tomatillo sauce topped with two eggs.  It was delicious. I also got a couple of extra tortillas that were perfect.  For desert the Flan topped it off - a perfect meal!  The flavors were perfect. It tasted so good that I was able to overlook the slow service.
author: J D.

description: Tried a bunch of stuff to share, food was rather bland. Not a lot of complex flavors, nothing stood out. Price point is ridiculous for the amount of food you get and the quality, well over a $100 bucks for some common Mexican dishes (and no alcohol). All this was topped off with the fact that we NEVER had a server. After 20 minutes of waiting, I had to flag the hostess down. She was sweet and apologetic, but even after this, still had no server for rest of the meal. Had to flag down passing employees several times throughout meal. Because they couldn't get their s%$@ together, was double charged on a few things.
author: J B.

description: Excellent Sangria, the food is fresh and very tasty, awesome new place in the Mission!!!
author: Kevin T.

description: I want this business to succeed. I have been watching it for a couple months now, and I want a business like this in the neighbourhood. Unfortunately, after our experience today, I'm not sure I can get my dining companions to return with me. It took an insanely long time to get menus, order taken, drinks (and we arrived right at opening.) The food was really tasty, but didn't feel fully fleshed out... they brought out plates, but you were still left thinking "where is the rest of it?" The tortillas were delicious and the guac was some of the best I've had in a restaurant, but we still left wondering whether we'd ever return. It just feels like they are giving a mobile food stand/food truck experience inside a restaurant. Just not as soulful and homey as I was expecting.
author: Heather H.

description: Great food, great service. Our first time and we will be back for sure! Comfort food that made a rainy night much nicer.
author: Andrea S.

description: This place does not have a good customer service .. I do not know the name of the manager but he is a jerk.  Not coming back n here
author: Carlos G.

description: I come from a Mexican family around the LA area, so I'm very picky about my Mexican food, but decided to try it out after seeing all the good reviews. Happy to say, it lived up to the hype! The food was delicious and I would come back next time I'm in the area
author: Veronica H.

description: The tacos were pretty average but the stews were great. The place is a touch pricey for what it is but I still give it a big thumbs up. Super friendly staff, nice interior and tasty food.
author: Mark C.

description: Wow. Some of the best Mexican food I've had. Rice beans and tortillas were incredible. Mole was also out of this world.
author: Josh G.

description: This is by far the BEST Mexican food I've had -- it's almost as good as my mom's home cooking so that is saying a lot! Came to San Francisco for a weekend trip and saw all the positive reviews this place had so we decided to check it out. I'm so glad we did! This place is one of the many reasons why I can't wait to return to San Fran!
author: Angelica H.

description: This place is great! My husband grew up in Mexico City and is really happy we've found a place with authentic Chilango cuisine. We love to support an immigrant-owned family business!
author: Nicole A.

description: Wow. I thought that many of the other Mexican restaurants in SF were already at the top bar in terms of tastiness and freshness, but this was better! Really really really good. Will be going back often.
author: Ben R.

description: Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but this was the most disappointing meal I've had in SF so far. I did ask the waitress what she recommends so it was even more disappointing. Overpriced small portions. Even the so called large would qualify as a medium at best. Do not come here if you're hungry. Had the Mole Rojo which tasted burned and bland with a couple of large chunks of chicken that needed to be cut into smaller pieces. Definitely not stew sized. All sides had to be ordered extra and were just as small and pricy. The best thing was the chips and guacamole. $65 for an unsatisfactory meal. Two stars for the funny menu and friendly service.
author: Eva B.

description: Mediocre and overpriced, the worst frijoles ever, 35 per  little frozen shrimps, you can get a full and tasty meal anywhere in the mission for that price, this place is overrated
author: Jose Ramon L.

description: Have great service. Very nice people, made my breakfast twice as delicious. Very lucky for me. The price was quite pricy but with the delicate food it is, it was worth it.
author: Jangmi M.

description: As authentic Mexico food as you will find. Delicious! Pride of ownership is apparent. Daily additions to menu.
author: Laura B.

description: Everything was perfect. Mole out of this world. Service was warm. Tortillas fresh. What a treat.
author: Anuj S.

description: So delicious! A refreshingly different Mexican restaurant, a far cry from typical Mission taquerias. I recommend Guisados, especially the Pollo en Mole Rojo. A family-run business that's cozy, charmingly decorated, and full of friendly people.
author: Dan C.

description: The mole is to die for, sopes are amazing and wine on tap is great.
author: Ashley K.

description: Excellent Mexican home cooked meals.   The price is inexpensive for San Francisco (price is always relative but to me this place is very inexpensive for the quality you get). The menu and the meals are authentically Mexican.
author: Arnold G.

description: Where to begin? The story of how this restaurant came to be is truly amazing. Just be sure to make a reservation unless you show up right when the doors open because the place fills up fast. The staff is friendly and service efficient. The food is great - we had the small pollo guisado (which was plenty for two with a side of rice & beans) and make sure to get the tortillas, they are absolutely fantastic. My only wish is that they had margaritas so I could sip it as I munch my guacamole and chips, but I get that liquor licenses are outrageous in this city. A bubbly glass of prosecco is certainly a suitable substitute. I rarely order dessert, but got the flan because I wanted the three course experience and I'm glad I did. It was one of the best I've had in a long time. What a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. Bienvenidos!
author: Rach D.

description: Fantastic food and service! If you're looking for a big SF burrito, don't come here. Authentic Mexico City fare. Yum!!!
author: Emille L.

description: Best Mexican in the Mission! I realize how weighted that phrase is and I mean it. Great food, warm service, consistently delivers. El burn comer is authentically delicious with the best mole I've ever come across.
author: Haley Y.

description: The place is simple, the food is great! My favorites are the salsa (just the right spice), sopes/tacos and the tacos dorados. With a bit more ambiance it would be a solid 5 star.
author: j-lo G.

description: Fantastic, authentic food. Great cozy setting for two, but highly recommended to come with a group and order the "buen comer" itself -- essentially a chef's choice dinner. It's an enormous feast with all those things on the menu that you want to try but never think to order. Awesome communal dining experience!
author: Dan C.

description: Comforting food. Welcoming by atmosphere. All the dishes we had were outstanding, many with ingredients or preparations I had never had before.
author: Katie T.

description: Stumbled upon this new restaurant and so glad we did! The restaurant is new so they are still getting their "sea legs" but the food is great, the atmosphere is clean and inviting and the service is friendly and accommodating. Authentic too!
author: Danielle L.

description: Super cute Mexican restaurant. Very friendly staff. Great food. We loved the tacos, sopas and tostada. The fried chicken dorados we're okay. The margarita was great too!
author: Jody M.

description: Food was delicious, but very small portions for the price. Service left much to be desired. I liked that I was able to make reservations for a big group especially for a Sunday brunch.
author: Crystal R.

description: What a terrific restaurant! Warm, friendly service and delicious home style Mexican food. I went with a group of eight, including four kids, and they brought the kids their food first - nice touch. Servings were just the right size - nobody left hungry, and not one bite was wasted. The mole I had was the best I've tasted. It reminded me of the delicious homemade food I've had in Mexico. The decor was great too. I'll be back!
author: Jay L.

description: Simply excellent; fresh authentic food, good value and great friendly service. Neighborhood gem. Let's keep it that way. Thank you Isabella and family/ staff. We had a great dinner.
author: C J.

description: Sopes and tacos are unreal. Get the chicken tinga with some spicy salsa. The atmosphere is relaxing, clean and modern-- a welcome addition to the Bernal Heights neighborhood.
author: Andrew K.

description: Dinner! (not just breakfast and brunch). A real jewel of a restaurant.  Excellent delicious food, great friendly service and it's affordable.
author: Linda B.

description: My new favorite Mexican restaurant on Mission Street. Great atmosphere. Full service. Very smooth and well balanced salsas and excellent guacamole!
author: Jaiya A.

description: I'm so excited about this place coming to Bernal Heights. Delicious food. Very Authentic. We loved every dish that we ordered. Check this place out!
author: Oona Q.

description: Very tasty food, a little bit overpriced for takeout. Really enjoyed the tacos dorados and guacamole and chips, but $8 for a cup and a half of guac is a bit pricey, guys.
author: Aaron A.

description: Sitting in my backyard, I can smell the delicious flavors from El Buen Comer wafting up and calling to me. The temptation and struggle to not eat here every day is real!
author: Danielle R.

description: Oh, wow! This place has truly great food. It makes me me wish that I grew up in a Latino family! Not cheap, but very good, well crafted dishes. I particularly recommend the guacamole and chips. The guacamole was the best I've ever had.
author: Christopher D.

description: Great service and great food! Very homemade style of cooking!
author: Jenny A.

description:
We've dined here 4 times and keep returning for the warm homestyle service and delicious cookery.
Last night, we finally discovered the "chefs family style choice" option on the menu.  I'm sorry, I can't remember the exact wording of this menu option, but basically it's a tasting menu featuring the chef's choices.  It's $40/person and starts with chips, guac and jicama salad . . . ends with fabulous flan and churros.
From start to finish it was amazing.  We've been here before and have enjoyed everything we've ordered, but having a sampling meal this way, took things over the top for us.
We started with chips/guac/jicama appetizers, then we were brought two huge platters of sopes and tacos.  Each one was described to us and the biggest dilemma for us was which was our favorite.
All this was followed by the entree courses consisting of 2 stews, rice, beans and summer squash w/ corn and tortillas.  
Finally the flan and the churros . . . fantastic.
Having lived in SF and near the Mission for 30+ years, we thought we'd had good Mexican food.  Dining at El Buen Comer makes me feel like we've actually discovered a whole new ethnic cuisine.
Don't get me wrong, when I'm craving a burrito, only La Taquiera or La Corneta will satisfy.  For me, El Buen Comer is Mexican food on another level.  Like how I love Mitchell's Ice Cream, but also always have to get a frozen yogurt at Costco . . . they are different and separate. You need both in your life, and one cannot replace the other.
The same now goes for El Buen Comer.  It's a second choice I never knew I needed in my life, but am oh so happy I found it.
author: bb b.

description:
Went to Buen Comer tonight for the first time and had a fantastic experience.   The service was impeccable and we were greeted immediately by such warm and welcoming server.  This is a rare treat in San Francisco and such a great way to start our visit.   
The food-SO GOOD.   We have kids (it's not really a kid resto but kids are welcome especially at 5 when we arrived) and they had the best quesadillas with home made tortillas and Oaxaca cheese.   The black bean side was rich and complex-so delish.   The Mexican stews made for sharing were hearty and smooth-pork with mole verde was so creamy,  meatballs were a crowd pleaser, and did I mention those tortillas??? Amazing corn, probably just made for us.  Wow!! This place is amazing, the food is so special and reasonably priced and the desert was off the hook. Best flan in town.  For real.  Rice pudding to die for and of course churros made to order.    Loved the wine list, the veer list has classic beers and some cool surprise Mexican craft beers and the aqua fresca was easily the best in the Mission.  I feel so lucky Buen Comer is in our hood.  We will be going there often.     
Run don't walk to have an authentic experience in a warm and welcoming setting.
author: Jennifer T.

description: LOVE.  Great flavors and love the family style servings.  We're still talking about how good the mole was.  Will definitely be back.  Only thing we didn't love was there was a bit of nickel and diming; they charge for chips, charge for rice, tortillas, beans, everything is a la carte.  Winds up being much more than you would think.  That said, it's worth it!  And they have good wine at reasonable prices (including a very nice $6 white) :)
author: Mana B.

description:
Incredible food. Made reservations for a Saturday brunch with my mother, who also loved everything we ordered. We started with the guacamole and then split egg tacos and the green mole pork. These were items that were written in on the menu, so I would imagine they're not always offered. The guacamole was great and refreshing. The pork was tender and the mole was delicious. It came with homemade tortillas which were fantastic. The egg tacos were slightly blander but only in comparison to the flavor packed pork, and still a great dish. 

The service was good, the staff was very attentive. We weren't in a rush but the meal wasn't very fast. Don't come in expecting to leave in 30 mins.
author: Scott R.

description: Read about this place in the newspaper. Sounded delicious  and it was. Chips and guacamole, all good. Nopale salad was delightful. Mole verde puerco, creamy, rich flavor with hint of spice. The black beans were good as well.  We had trouble deciding on dessert, so we ate two. Arroz con leche was creamy, tender not too sweet. The flan with coconut was outstanding. Try the hibiscus drink, sweet and refreshing. The cabotella beer was so good with our meal.  This restaurant is very busy after 6pm, so it's best to make reservations. Service was very well done. Decor is minimal, very noisy inside. Needs something to muffle all the noise. Am I going back, oh yeah, so many other things to try on the menu.
author: Gale M.

description: This is the place to go for authentic, high quality Mexican food in the Mission. We met the team (a family I believe) when they were running a wonderful food truck at the Noe Valley farmer's market. Their food was outstanding then and it remains so. The restaurant somehow manages to capture what I believe to be more traditional cuisine with the food now being served at more trendy and expensive taco places that populate downtown. We plan to be regulars. As the place can apparently get crowded, we are not alone in our enthusiasm for the restaurant.
author: Steven D.

description: Beautiful space and delicious food. I had the Jicama con Naranja and the Chilaquiles Rojos. The ingredients tasted fresh and flavorful. I will be back again.
author: Barney C.

description: Had a wonderful dinner here tonight.  The food was unique and very tasty.  The wait staff was very polished and professional.  Our waiter, Diego, did an excellent job explaining the menu.  This is a wonderful addition to the area.
author: Judith W.

description:
This was a very authentic and delicious meal. We went for brunch and enjoyed the chilaquiles. Yum!

The space was modern and clean. Lots of seating.

Can't wait to return for one of their guisados!
author: Bronya F.

description: Authentic tasty Mexican food. The music is great! The service is great. The sopes are a bit smaller than I am use to seeing them but very tasty. The tacos dorados are very delicious, they put oregano in the chicken which gave it an amazing taste. I am excited about coming here again and trying other items in the menu.
author: Ivania M.

description: Let's start with the easy part: Food is very good! My wife, mother-in-law, our little daughter and I stop at "El Buen Comer" for brunch earlier today. Started with the Chips and Guacamole, we had the Milanesa, Tacos Dorados and the "Puerco en Mole Verde". All dishes were delicious, minor comment for the tortillas as they were not as thin and crispy as we expected but the wonderful flavor was definitely there. Now for the tricky part, the service. I understand this is a small place but there were many issues: I know that baby strollers can be painful and tricky for restaurant managers, however we requested a table in the back located next to a column, one of the servers told us in a very rude tone that we couldn't put the stroller there. I get the rules but in this case it turned out that the people sitting at the same table before us had one parked there!!! Besides we were able to take the seat out fold it and no extra space was taken. Strike One. My wife noticed then a piece of glass on the floor, of course accidents will happen but even after we pointed that out to another server he just limited to pick up another small piece of glass, 10 minutes after that we found out another piece. Just take a broom and clean it. After that I'm not sure why we stayed. Food delivery was rather harsh as my wife's plate was almost thrown on the table. We never got anybody to stop by and ask how everything was. Love the food, I hope the restaurant does good as it is in our neighborhood but service has to improve.
author: German G.

description: Just another over-priced restaurant for average food. Very small portions. No sugar free drinks. When I go to a Mexican restaurant, and there are no Mexican people eating there, it speaks volumes.  Those raving about this food do not know what really good down-home Mexican food tastes like.  They must be impressed by the decor.  Sorry.  From one born and raised in the Mission and of Italian and Mexican heritage.  The food at La Palma on 24th street tastes better with more flavor.
author: Jo Alan P.

description:
Went there  a few weeks ago. It wasn't the most pleasant  experience  and I thought  I'd let it lie but I decided I must share. As a native San Franciscan  I have to say there are better tasting, more welcoming restaurants in the Mission. Like someone else mentioned, it's a sign when there aren't any latinos eating at the establishment.  Overall I found  the food to be bland and portions were on the smaller side. The worst was the service.  It took entirely too long to have our order taken and receive our food. When we got our chips and guacamole I noticed  something on a couple of the chips. Is it hair? Upon closer inspection  it appeared to be fiber, maybe from a kitchen towel. When it was brought to the attention  of the waiter they tried to explain  it was from the basket it was served in. The basket  did not have hair like fibers. They offered  to replace it.  Do you even  have to ask? It was replaced  only to have a big fiber ball on the outside of the guacamole  ramekin. Waitstaff which I believe were the two sons, noticed  us inspecting  the dish right away and came and asked us what was wrong. We showed  them, but said it was fine as it was on the outside of dish.  Their  response was "we're not perfect", and said we didn't  have to pay for it if we didn't  want to or like it, and walked away. Really?
What a poor response. Poor customer service. Never again. On the positive side, I guess you can be assured they're cleaning things. There's trace towel fibers around to prove it.
author: F K.

description: I wanted to come here for a while and finally did. It's hard for me to write a lukewarm review for a well meaning place, but I have to be honest. The food isn't bad. It's not great. It's just fine. We got the camarones plate that comes with rice and beans for $17!! And that's where they lose stars with me. For a few pieces of spicy shrimp and some staple sides, it was way too much money. The plate came with 2 handmade tortillas that were smaller than the size of my palm. When I asked for more, they said they would have to charge me extra. So I declined. The guacamole with their homemade tortilla chips was good. I also got a $4 cactus taco which I regretted. It wasn't anything exciting. And it was tiny! I kinda wished I had gone to one of Mission's fine taquerias for more food at 1/3 of the price! Service was good though. I can't knock them got anything other than ok food for way too much money. I just had to try it.
author: Julesy T.

description: Came here for an early dinner on a Sunday. Great food for a great price, friendly service.  The sopes and tacos were excellent, specifically.  Will definitely be back.
author: F G.

description: So glad they are open for lunch.  Today's special is the enchiladas con mole.  The mole is delicious!  Got mine with shredded chicken, which is gorgeous.
author: Lisa M.

description: 1st impression is the lasting! Nothing spectacular. Food ok, but not for big eaters! Good for someone that is on the run and off to a movie. A little over priced for comfort food.
author: T R.

description: A beautiful restaurant with staff that makes you feel like you are a guest in their home. You can taste the love they put into their dishes.
author: Scott K.

description: Best Mexican food that I've had outside of Mexico. The mole was phenomenal. I will have to resist dining here everyday.
author: Jana R.

description: Have enjoyed the dishes from El Buen Comer for years at catered events. Loved being able to have the pollo a la crema in the BEAUTIFUL new space. The food was just delicious. A great new addition to the neighborhood. Can't wait to go again!!
author: A. P.

description: I came to have a brunch with my family the place is very clean and nice mexican decoration the service was fast and we order it a guacamole and chips was so yummi and the salsas wow yummi spicy everything we order was very good. I highly recomended this place if you really want to eat  mexican food  i will back for sure !!
author: Erika M.

description: I went for lunch and the food was great! The staff were also very friendly! I will definitely be going back, and look forward to trying the dinner menu!
author: Caitlin H.

description: I am lucky enough to live right next to this delicious place. We had the albondigas, tinga, calabazas, rice, beans and sopes. The staff was nice and very attentive. The price was good considering there was 9 of us. This is a place that is worth trying.
author: Ana M.

description: Hmm, was excited to try this new Sit Down Mex restaurant. LIke the decor, dig the bar, but food is just okay. Yes they say they are authentic Mexican food, yet it is lacking something. Flavor, heat, portions, choice? It lacks flavor or heat for sure, it also lacks sort of that grubbin feelin ya get when you eat kick ass mexican food or any food really that is GOOD. Food was cold, chips were good, guacamole was kickin, tacos were pretty good but lackluster...HA and the bowls of the authentic dishes were just ho hum, boring bland and cold. I cant go back, sorry. Hipsters are diggin this place though, not a latino in sight,but ultra new hip ppl who think SF is hella cool will dig this spot.
author: SForiginal T.

description: Really good authentic and traditional mexican cuisine. The corn tortillas are fresh and are a great taste baseline for the rest of the food. We loved the sopes. Also, the mole verde had a creamy, spicy, and full green spice that made the dish. I'd stay away from the calabacitas (squash) and instead opt for a special platter or guacamole.
author: David M.

description: Fabulous!!! We had dinner there 2 nights ago and we're still talking about the delicious food. Not your run of the mill Mexican food. We'll be back often. Great service and great food, what more could you want? I'm afraid to post this review because I just may be reviewing myself out of a table, it's that good!!
author: David P.

description: A gorgeous and family-run business that serves the most delicious Chilequiles in town? Their salsa verde has the perfect amount of heat and tang. Plus, Isabel and her family are gems. Great community members serving great food. I've been back three times already and they've only been open a month!
author: Tara R.
